author: Ross Burden
method: Whisk together the eggs, cream, sugar, cinnamon and mixed spice. Dip the crumpets into the mixture to coat. Melt the butter in a non stick frying pan and fry the crumpets, drizzling over extra mixture, if needed, for 1-2 minutes per side, until golden. For the sauce, place the mandarins and syrup with the white wine vinegar and sugar into a saucepan and boil to reduce for 2-3 minutes. Whip the cream and fold through the orange zest. To serve, place two crumpets on each of two plates, top with a dollop of the orange cream and drizzle over the syrup to finish.
ingredients: 2 free-range eggs,  55ml/2fl oz double cream,  55g/2oz caster sugar,  ½ tsp cinnamon,  ½ tsp mixed spice,  4 ready-made crumpets,  15g/½oz butter,  ½ tin mandarins, drained, syrup reserved,  1 tbsp white wine vinegar,  ½ tbsp caster sugar,  55ml/2fl oz double cream,  zest of 1 orange,  fresh mint leaves, to garnish
